title: Cancel culture: Have any two words become more weaponised?
description: What do a series of recent controversies tell us about the politics around "cancel culture"?

title: 'I rescued my son after lightning set fire to our home'
description: Kerry Quinn stumbled upstairs through the smoke to reach her sleeping teenage son, before taking him out to safety.

title: Strong decline in coronavirus across England since January, React study shows
description: Study finds infections fell by two-thirds - and more in London - but warns virus levels remain high.

title: Summerseat explosion: Woman dead and two people injured
description: The woman, who has not been indentified, was found following the house's collapse, police say.

title: Sir Keir Starmer: Savings scheme would boost UK's recovery post-Covid
description: The Labour leader also proposes an extra £1bn to fund small businesses to help revive Britain post-Covid.

title: Indian Premier League: Moeen Ali goes for nearly £700,00 to Chennai Super Kings
description: England all-rounder Moeen Ali is bought for £700,000 by Chennai Super Kings at the Indian Premier League auction, while Dawid Malan is picked up by Punjab Kings.

title: Australia news code: What’s this row with Facebook and Google all about?
description: A law that would force tech firms to pay for news is being closely watched globally. We explain why.

title: Black and LGBT Edinburgh University students attacked in Zoom meeting
description: The attackers shouted racist slurs and played pornography during the University of Edinburgh student union event.

title: BBC Woman's Hour accused of 'hostile' interview with Muslim leader
description: Woman's Hour is accused of being "hostile" towards the Muslim Council of Britain's first female head.

title: Top seed Djokovic beats qualifier Karatsev to reach Australian Open final
description: Top seed Novak Djokovic overcomes stern resistance from Aslan Karatsev to reach the Australian Open final and end the Russian qualifier's remarkable run.

title: Covid-19: Record number of students apply for nursing
description: Figures show there has been a 32% increase in applications for nursing courses at UK universities.

title: Commercial TV channels unite to screen Covid vaccine myth-busting video
description: The celebrity-led film will urge people from ethnic minority communities to have the Covid jab.

title: Facebook Australia: PM Scott Morrison 'will not be intimidated' by tech giant
description: Scott Morrison says Facebook's decision to block news feeds to users is "arrogant and disappointing".

title: Smart materials: From tiny robots to colour-swapping clothes
description: A report examines the potential of materials that can change shape, adapt and repair themselves.

title: Texas weather: Residents told to boil tap water amid power blackouts
description: Water treatment facilities are hit as many struggle with power cuts and frigid conditions.

title: Brexit charges: Why is my online shopping more expensive?
description: Some UK customers have been hit by extra charges since Brexit but why?

title: 'If I ever say farewell, I wouldn't tell anyone' - watch as Williams leaves news conference in tears
description: Serena Williams leaves her Australian Open news conference in tears after her semi-final defeat by Naomi Osaka.

title: Coronavirus: Barclays says loans worth £4.8bn may never be repaid
description: Barclays sees profits dive after setting aside billions for loans expected to turn sour due to Covid.

title: Is this London’s thinnest house?
description: A house which is thought to be the narrowest in London is up for sale with a price tag of nearly £1m.

title: Demi Lovato 'had three strokes and a heart attack' after 2018 overdose
description: The singer reveals she was minutes from death after a 2018 overdose, and "left with brain damage".

title: Coronavirus: Vaccine-trial participants pose for portraits
description: British photographer Fran Monks used Zoom to capture images of volunteers from around the world.

title: Osaka to face Brady in Australian Open final after beating Williams
description: Naomi Osaka will face Jennifer Brady in the Australian Open final after beating Serena Williams and ending the American's quest for a record-equalling 24th Grand Slam title.

title: Olympics: Team GB climber Shauna Coxsey on training for Tokyo from her basement
description: Team GB climber Shauna Coxsey is preparing for sport climbing's Olympics debut - if it goes ahead.

title: 'I want to be the first, but never the last' - NFL's Russell on coming out as bisexual
description: Ryan Russell tells BBC Sport about coming out as bisexual in 2019 and his hopes to be the first openly gay or bi man to play an NFL game.

title: The Papers: '£4,500 to get Covid' and 'parents test children'
description: Thursday's papers report the Duke of Edinburgh's admission to hospital, and new rapid school tests.

title: Prince Philip spends second night in hospital
description: The 99-year-old duke is said to be in "good spirits" at London's King Edward VII Hospital.

title: Archie Brennan: Discover why Prue Leith loves this little known artist's work
description: The Bake Off judge loves his work and he had famous friends so why is he not more celebrated?

title: Texas weather: Are frozen wind turbines to blame for power cuts?
description: Frozen wind turbines are being blamed for power failures - but problems with fossils fuels are a bigger issue.

title: How Afghanistan police train for Taliban attacks and suicide bombers
description: Police in Afghanistan are training to deal with militant attacks amid Taliban threats.

title: 'Clothes should float in and out of our lives'
description: The companies that are adopting a "circular economy" model to doing business.

title: Covid: How work life changed for a home-schooler and a supermarket manager
description: How the pandemic has changed work life for a home-schooling parent and a supermarket manager.

title: Nasa Perseverance rover: How this Mars landing will be different
description: Nasa's Perseverance rover is aiming for Jezero Crater, considered “too dangerous” for previous spacecraft.

title: Broadband credit score mistake 'cost me £3,500'
description: Omar Khalid says a mistake by broadband provider Virgin Media damaged his credit score for years.

title: Covid and suicide: Japan's rise a warning to the world?
description: For the first time in 11 years, suicide among women has gone up, and the pandemic is playing a part.
